ygData.subject: Re: [eqbards] Changes on Test for all Classes.
ygData.msgSnippet: Or are you too new to remember the ... New to a bard, but not to EQ.  Started 2 months after it went live. ... do ... the ... I apologize, then.  I am sick of
ygData.messageBody:
Or are you too new to remember the
> chains debacle?

New to a bard, but not to EQ. Started 2 months after it went live.

"Cranfill, Wendy" wrote:
> Yes I believe I said I DID read the whole post. I know they will plan to
> downlevel the mobs. I just hope they actually do it. It has nothing to
do
> with loot but everything to do with conquoring challenges. I just like
the
> challenges to be fair.

I apologize, then. I am sick of seeing posts (mainly on eqcasters) of
people only seeing the things that upset them and not the other side. To me
your post seemed like you did not see the point of tuning them down. Again,
I apologize, I must have missed that in your post.

As far as Verant history. What other choice do you have but to trust that
they will do what they say? Not much other than quit. I understand not
liking the update, but some poeple get *SO* mad, it scares me. This is a
game, nothing more.

I for one, would rather play a slightly "nerfed" EQ, then no EQ at all.

I still think the BP is overpowered the way it is.

You need to think of what is realistic for the genre not of what would be
neat. I wish my druid had a 1200 point DD, just like wizards wish they
could cast SOW. Melee wish they could bind/gate. But those don't make
sense. Neither does such a breastplate. At least not to me.

I am sorry, if offended anyone. It was not my intent, just expressing my
views.

Notebender
9th Bard of Veeshan
